[Shader Mixer Classes]

Base class for all brick parameter types. More...

#include <dzbrickparam.h>

Detailed Description

Base class for all brick parameter types.

This is the base class for all brick parameters that are owned or controlled by Shader Bricks.

See also:
DzShaderBrick

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzBrickParam::ParamDirection

The connection direction types of the param.

Enumerator:
None 

Not input or output

In 

This type is an in param

Out 

This type is the output param

enum DzBrickParam::ParamType

The RSL type for this parameter

Enumerator:
Unknown 

No RSL type

Float 

RSL float type

Color 

RSL color type

Point 

RSL Point type

Vector 

RSL Vector type

Normal 

RSL Normal type

Matrix 

RSL Matrix type

String 

RSL String type

param brick param to check if it is valid to connect to

int DzBrickParam::getScopePosition (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
returns the scope in the shader brick that this param belongs to. -1, the default, indicates global scope. A value of 0 or higher indicates a specific scope.
See also:
DzShaderBrick::getNumScopesNeeded,DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall

ParamType DzBrickParam::getTypeForToken ( int  i  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]
Parameters:
i The index of the token to get the type for
Returns:
The type for the given token index. Tokens do not necessarily match the param type. For instance to the param type of DzVec3Param is a Point, Normal, or Vector, but all of its tokens are of type Float.

Reimplemented in DzEnumParam, DzMatrixParam, DzPropertyParam, and DzVec3Param.

const DzVec3 &  vec

bool DzBrickParam::giveArrayAsList (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
if this is an array parameter indicate that the given variable for this input should a comma separated list of values as opposed to a single array variable. i.e. if true the input will be "a[0],a[1],a[2]" if false the input will be "a". Where "a" is an array of elements of the same type as this param. False by default.

if this param is an Array or not.

) [virtual]

Parameters:
val set the global default value for this brick. This should be a global value such as N,P,s,t,etc. A shader brick will look at this value to determine if it can connect to another brick.

void DzBrickParam::setPointer ( const DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID,
short  pointerID,
DzBase *  ptr 
) [virtual]

Called by the framework when reading a native file. Derived classes should override this method if they ever write out pointer values to the data file. This method will be called with the sectionID and pointerID that were given when writing the file out. The passed pointer may be shared so should not be deleted.

Parameters:
file The file being loaded
sectionID The ID of the file section being read
pointerID The ID of the pointer being read.
ptr The pointer being read.

Reimplemented from DzBase.

Reimplemented in DzEnumParam, DzMatrixParam, DzOutParam, DzPropertyParam, and DzVec3Param.

void DzBrickParam::setScopePosition ( int  position  )  [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
position the scope to set this param for
Note:

bool DzBrickParam::shouldWriteTokenInShader ( int  i  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if the token should be writen in the shader, false otherwise. This should be only set to true if the ParamDirection is None.

Reimplemented in DzDefaultInParam, DzEnumParam, DzMatrixParam, DzPropertyParam, and DzVec3Param.
